Classics. If I think of co-op shooters, this game comes to mind almost instantly, following closely [i][b]Borderlands[/b][/i] series. It is important for you to understand though, that if you are willing to play both of [i][b]Left 4 Dead[/b][/i] franchise games, you ought to start with this one. Otherwise, it would be a strange trip coming back.
Fantastic game for those who love twitch shooters. Hordes and Tanks are the freaken best. I would reccomend this game to any zombie lover. Age (9+)

Have you ever asked yourself, if the zombie apocalypse were to happen right now, what would I use to defend myself? Thatâ€™s like Left 4 Dead. Sure, itâ€™s got first-person shooter gunplay at its heart, but with ammo limited, sooner or later. You and your friends will enter an atmosphere is dark and dank with a terrifying feeling of hopelessness as you and your team make it to every new safehouse in a worse state than before. One of the best cooperative game i ever owned.
Fantastic rock paper sissor zombie killing action that flourishes when you add more and more friends to the mix.

[h1]An excellent game, but made redundant by the existence of Left 4 Dead 2[/h1]

The only reason I own this game is that I bought the Valve Complete Pack at one point.

Don't get me wrong, I absolutely love Left 4 Dead and I love Valve. I'll admit I originally played a pirated copy but I've long since gone legit starting with Left 4 Dead 2.

However, every single L4D1 campaign (with all the original characters including voice lines) has been officially ported over to Left 4 Dead 2. The sequel has a larger, more interesting variety of weapons and enemies. The modding community churns out far more content for the sequel than for the first game. The sequel is a better game in every aspect.

Support Valve, but do so by buying Left 4 Dead 2. The first game is a waste of money because it literally is fully included (and enhanced) in the sequel.

***WARNING***

Buy Left 4 Dead 2; it has the same exact weapons, characters, and maps plus more for literally the same exact price.

It IS a fun game, though. Also, look for it on sale because they both usually go down to about $5 during the big Steam sales.

But for real, I wasted $5 on this game. There's no real value to this one since L4D2 is just a better version of it in every way.

why not the "left 4 dead" combine with "The Last Stand:Dead Zone"(create by CON ARTIST GAMES Pty.Ltd)?the survivor can expand from 4 to many more,even there is only 4 human player,but they can be accompany with A.I player..(example:4 human player +6 AI,there can be engineer,medic,scavenger,soldier,and so others...)

we can collect food from supermarket,weapons and ammo(ammo is limited so they will be nervous to fire their weapons) from weapon shops,police stations,and military bases and so many more...!!!

we can also fight with combat vehicle(APC,MAIN BATTLE TANK,ARMED CAR) against tanks and what so ever....:)

it can be more fun...

Go to Zombie game for me and Halloween game extrodinaire.....The best Left for Dead hands down. Sure L4D2 has more weapons and is more up to date source graphics wise, but L4D1 is the original and still king. Better maps, better atmosphere, the characters are much more likeable and when you look down, you can see your legs.  10/10 rating from me.
One of the greatest games ever to play with your friends.

Best zombies FPS game that I played. From the first minute I loved L4D. Then you realize that the main thing in the game is teamwork. Beginners can immediately play with bots single, in any case, do not go online, or instant kick / ban provided! On some servers, you must earn a reputation that you don't kick / ban. There are modified servers on which the gameplay is expanded and increased the number of players. The best mode of the game is versus. I recommend to all fans of zombies!

simply an amazing game, ive played alot of zombie games in my time and if i ever get asked "hey dude, whats ur favourite zombie game?"; i tell em "l4d is the best" because it's true. sure you get games like the last of us or dead space but left 4 dead will always be on top. i feel as though l4d set the bar for zombie games and other companies have tried to go beyond (i'm looking at you techland :/) and failed. what left 4 dead is, is a 4 player coop zombie shootem' up. if you're looking for a strong narative, you wont find it here but what you will find is a near endless amount of fun to be had with friends and the fact that you don't have to pay for DLC for this is a bonus, unlike the 360 :(. speaking of DLC, modders are alwaays making something new like weapons, character skins and maps so basically you get a wide variety of DLC to choose from so if you're fed up of the same old skins, weapons, maps etc. then you have the option to look for something to suit your needs!
I hope my review-thing was helpful.
Also, if you are looking to get l4d2 too, wait for one of Steam's sales and you can pick up both games for Â£5; thats how i got mine lol!
must have co op fps game

After playing this on the PC, I see the superiority of running this on better hardware. L4D is a great squad based shooter that gets even more fanatic with the more people you play with. The graphics, as well as the cues from some of the stronger characters in the game, always gives the quessy feeling wondering whats around the corner. I love this game, but its hard for me to recommend over it's sequal and expansion back, since the expansion leaves you play the original game with melee weapons and the newer monsters. Awesome game!

This game is a ton of fun solo, coop, versus and survial! I played this game a lot on the 360 and to play it again on PC is a blast. This is my most played game in my library. I play a little bit of L4D2 but something about the first installment keeps me coming back.
